Package com.adobe.pdfservices.operation.pdfops

Class DocumentMergeOperation

java.lang.Object
com.adobe.pdfservices.operation.pdfops.DocumentMergeOperation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operation
public class DocumentMergeOperation extends Object implements Operation
An operation that enables the clients to produce high fidelity mobile-optimized PDF documents and Word documents with dynamic data inputs. This operation merges the JSON data with the Word template to create dynamic documents for contracts and agreements, invoices, proposals, reports, forms, branded marketing documents and more.

The generated PDF is optimized for mobile viewing experience using Adobe's Liquid Mode in the Acrobat Reader App. This feature of generating mobile-optimized PDF documents is in Beta and not ready to use in production.

To know more about document generation and document templates, please see the documentation

Sample Usage: 

  JSONObject jsonDataForMerge = new JSONObject("{\"customerName\": \"James\",\"customerVisits\": 100}");
   DocumentMergeOptions documentMergeOptions = new DocumentMergeOptions(jsonDataForMerge, OutputFormat.PDF);
   DocumentMergeOperation docMergeOperation = DocumentMergeOperation.createNew(documentMergeOptions);
   documentMergeOptions.setInput(FileRef.createFromLocalFile("~/Documents/documentTemplate.docx",
                                                           DocumentMergeOptions.SupportedSourceFormat.DOCX.getMediaType()));
   Credentials credentials = Credentials.serviceAccountCredentialsBuilder().fromFile("pdfservices-api-credentials.json").build();
   FileRef result = createPdfOperation.execute(ExecutionContext.create(credentials));
   result.saveAs("output/DocumentMergeOutput.pdf");

    • execute

      public FileRef execute(ExecutionContext context) throws ServiceApiException, IOException, ServiceUsageException
      Executes this operation synchronously using the supplied context and returns a new FileRef instance for the resulting Merged file.

      The resulting file may be stored in the system temporary directory (per java.io.tmpdir System property). See FileRef for how temporary resources are cleaned up.

      Specified by:
      execute in interface Operation
      Parameters:
      context - the context in which to execute the operation
      Returns:
      the resulting merged document
      Throws:
      ServiceApiException - if an API call results in an error response
      IOException - if there is an error in reading either the input source or the resulting PDF file
      ServiceUsageException - if service usage limits have been reached or credentials quota has been exhausted
